subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] listening to posts
author: Ron Lederer
full_text:

Bruce   No offense but I think you, Frank and some others in the group could yodel and record messages from that?  I'll keep working at it...hopefully someone will get through.  Ron L

bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:          Ron,
 
I am recording at around 87% speed.
just check the box for use cue list and leave the rest the way it is.
Take your time and it will come.
 
bruce


  Bruce Halliday 




    
---------------------------------
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
From: ronriko@...
Date: Thu, 27 Mar 2008 12:41:08 -0700
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] listening to posts

      Hi Bruce and group    I appreciate these new files with evpmaker because I am unable to get any meaningful radio signals here in Mexico to use my RS hacks.  I manage to be classic evps but no direct response messages or two way.   This gives me hope of accomplishing something more.  Question for Bruce, I am guessing your speed when playing and recording the evp session is around 90% no?  Also, are you using the Zcross or x fade features?  How about segments 80 plus or minus?   I have tried Stephans download of speaker jet vowels with wavemaker but can't pick out anything from the other side.  When I listen to your files, some messages pop out and others I listen to many times and still get nothing.  I am convinced it is my tin ear and the messages exist in your files.  Plan to put myself through a training program at this end to hear the messages...then maybe I can successfully get my own sessions going.  Thanks for your efforts.  And, I thank Stephan for sharing his
 files and knowledge.  Ron L  

bhali333 <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:       
I know everybody including myself says"oh no not another 10 files to 
listen too" but I think these files from this new method are worth the 
effort.

Give a listen and lets start getting some opinions on this new EVPM 
method.

bruce
